#topic Erlay WG Update (sr_gi, gleb, marcofleon)
#here
I've been running the last set of planned simulations this week. I'm currently moving to implementing the changes on the open PR so we can test this with real nodes
Will be trying this on Warnet as soon as we have a working version, and then proceed with the PR
The results on simulation look promising :)
That's it on my end
#topic Kernel WG Update (TheCharlatan)
hi
We discussed some ways forward towards getting the kernel API merged during the recent dev meeting.
The consensus was that the current API is not likely to get shipped in the upcoming release
Especially its reliance on assumeutxo mechanics and inflexibility towards other validation models are painpoints

At the same time, building out applications a bit more to inform design decisions, as well as getting better feedback on how the API changes as validation code evolves would be easier to do if the API were merged sooner than later.
"not likely to get shipped in the upcoming release" <-- 29.0 or 30.0?
So the focus in the near term will likely be trying to get it merged over the next months, albeit not slated as a library shipped in the releases quite yet.
achow101: 30
hi
hi
I will also try to work on a separate "big branch" with many of the desired changes to get the API into shape similarly to what Carl did to initially get a library together.
that's all from me :)
#topic MuSig2 WG Update (achow101)
I've addressed recent reviews on #31622
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/31622 | psbt: add non-default sighash types to PSBTs and unify sighash type match checking by achow101 路 Pull Request #31622 路 bitcoin/bitcoin 路 GitHub
I had to add a check that signatures are valid DER since one of the recent pushes caused a fuzz test failure
This is possibly a breaking change, although I don't expect it to actually impact anyone
The other current PRs to review are #31247 and #31243.
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/31247 | psbt: MuSig2 Fields by achow101 路 Pull Request #31247 路 bitcoin/bitcoin 路 GitHub

https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/31243 | descriptor: Move filling of keys from `DescriptorImpl::MakeScripts` to `PubkeyProvider::GetPubKey` by achow101 路 Pull Request #31243 路 bitcoin/bitcoin 路 GitHub
#31243 seems rfm once we branch

https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/31243 | descriptor: Move filling of keys from `DescriptorImpl::MakeScripts` to `PubkeyProvider::GetPubKey` by achow101 路 Pull Request #31243 路 bitcoin/bitcoin 路 GitHub
#topic Legacy Wallet Removal WG Update (achow101)
Sjors opened #31961 which pulls out the commit the makes sqlite required when the wallet is enabled.
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/31961 | Require sqlite when building the wallet by Sjors 路 Pull Request #31961 路 bitcoin/bitcoin 路 GitHub
I've rebased #31250 and #28710 to on top of it.
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/31250 | wallet: Disable creating and loading legacy wallets by achow101 路 Pull Request #31250 路 bitcoin/bitcoin 路 GitHub
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/28710 | Remove the legacy wallet and BDB dependency by achow101 路 Pull Request #28710 路 bitcoin/bitcoin 路 GitHub
As was mentioned at CoreDev, these PRs are primarily deletions and it would be great to get these in to help reduce scope :)
hi
oh we're reducinngggg

#topic 29.0 Milestone
Ok not sure if my connection is strong enough but:
There are a few small things left before we can do branch-off, e.g. #31960 which needs some review.
Please also remember to add release notes and check your name in the credits https://github.com/bitcoin-core/bitcoin-devwiki/wiki/29.0-Release-Notes-draft
In particular I'm waiting on a CMake note from hebasto and a -O3 note from sipa
I think we are aiming for a RC testing guide meeting on March 19
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/31960 | seeds: add signet/testnet4, update makeseeds regex, minblocks, fixed seeds by jonatack 路 Pull Request #31960 路 bitcoin/bitcoin 路 GitHub
you skipped the fuzzing wg
dergoegge: oops, didn't see you. will do after this topic
The milestone is https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/milestone/69
The only non-procedural pr is #31161
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/31161 | cmake: Set top-level target output locations by hebasto 路 Pull Request #31161 路 bitcoin/bitcoin 路 GitHub
Was there a resolution to that? IIRC it was discussed by a few people at CoreDev.

[bitcoin] fanquake opened pull request #32009: RFC contrib: turn off compression of macOS SDK to fix determinism (across distros) (master...macos_sdk_select) https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32009
There's also still a bunch of build system issues open. Are they being fixed or punted to the next release?
glozow: still planning to branch today?
We can wait a few days
glozow: achow101: I'll update the seeds pull shortly, might ping here if any questions
hi
I'd rather wait than backport
jon_atack: thanks
indeed
might be dropping off now, sorry
#topic Fuzzing WG Update (dergoegge)
For those that didn't attend the "functional fuzz test" spark session at coredev, I briefly summarized the idea here: https://gist.github.com/dergoegge/3036796551095a9ce7535fb5d74e6656
I'll occasionally give updates on this effort here or in the fuzzing wg
#proposedmeetingtopic review club (stickies-v)
achow101: Unknown command: #proposedmeetingtopic
#topic review club (stickies-v)
we had a brief in-person discussion last week about reviewing the review club (https://bitcoincore.reviews/ )
one suggestion with good support was to give space to working groups to host PRs that theyd like more discussion or transparency on
so, are there any WGs interested in proposing (and ideally hosting) a PR review club?
hi

if it's okay with everyone, i'll make this a semi-recurring topic on this meeting, but you can always leave a request/suggestion on our newly pinned issue: https://github.com/bitcoin-core-review-club/website/issues/791
stickies-v: feel free to propose it as a topic whenever you want to
thank you! that's all for me
sipa: would you like to give a cluster mempool update?
stickies-v: there seems to be support for returning to a weekly format
achow101: sure
ofc that is load mostly on you two unless the same people are willing to host
jon_atack: so far we have 0 people offering to host, though :D
#topic Cluster Mempool WG Update (sdaftuar, sipa)
yes. hosting twice a year by a dozen or two people would move the dial on that. I would do that if you need.
not that much to report, #31363 has started getting reviews (thanks, abubakarsadiq and instagibbs!), looks to make good progress
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/31363 | cluster mempool: introduce TxGraph by sipa 路 Pull Request #31363 路 bitcoin/bitcoin 路 GitHub
on the research side, i've been having good discussions with aj and others about a min-cut linearization algorithm, i hope to have a prototype to experiment with soon
that's it for me
Any other topics to discuss this week?

@jon_atack I think it may be due to a lack of interest in hosting that it is only once a month. If I recall correctly, there have been multiple review clubs in the past after we switched to a monthly schedule when there was interest
#endmeeting
